content.description: A zoo sponsored a one-day contest to name a new baby elephant. Zoo visitors deposited entries in a special box between noon (t=0) and 8 P.M. (t=8) . The number of entries in the box t hours after noon is modeled by a differentiable function E for 0 ≤ t ≤ 8  Values of E(t) , in hundreds of entries, at various times t are shown in the table above.
content.question: Use a trapezoidal sum with the four subintervals given by the table to approximate the value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>8</mn> </mfrac> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>8</mn> </msubsup> <mi>E</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>8</mn> </mfrac> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>8</mn> </msubsup> <mi>E</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math> in terms of the number of entries.

frqParts.text: Use a trapezoidal sum with the four subintervals given by the table to approximate the value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>8</mn> </mfrac> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>8</mn> </msubsup> <mi>E</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>8</mn> </mfrac> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>8</mn> </msubsup> <mi>E</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math> in terms of the number of entries.

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
